PropertySetDef.Name: Pset_SwitchingDeviceTypeSwitchDisconnector
PropertySetDef.Definition: Definition from IEC 441-14-12: A switch disconnector is a switch which in the open position satisfies the isolating requirements specified for a disconnector.

PropertyDef.Name: SwitchDisconnectorType
PropertyDef.Definition:
A list of the available types of switch disconnector from which that required may be selected where:
CenterBreak - A disconnector in which both contacts of each pole are movable and engage at a point substantially midway between their supports. (IEC 441-14-08) DividedSupport - A disconnector in which the fixed and moving contacts of each pole are not supported by a common base or frame. (IEC 441-14-06) DoubleBreak - A disconnector that opens a circuit at two points. (IEC 441-14-09) EarthingSwitch - A disconnector in which the fixed and moving contacts of each pole are not supported by a common base or frame. (IEC 441-14-07) Isolator - A disconnector which in the open position satisfies isolating requirements. (IEC 441-14-12)

PropertyDef.Name: LoadDisconnectionType
PropertyDef.Definition: A list of the available types of load disconnection from which that required may be selected.

PropertyDef.Name: HasVisualIndication
PropertyDef.Definition: Indicates whether a means of being to visually ascertain whether the contacts are open or closed is fitted (= TRUE) or not (= FALSE)
